intro: Cerastium caespitosum var. cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy, ovate leaves and produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
